<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// CommandLine options of class type are not directly supported with some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// specific exceptions like std::string which are safe to copy. In our case,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the &#96;FnT&#96; function&#95;ref object is also safe to copy. So provide a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// specialization of &#96;OptionValue&#96; for &#96;FnT&#96; type that stores it as a copy.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is essentially similar to OptionValue&lt;std::string&gt; specialization for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// strings.</span></CodeLine>
